Title: Shettima commends Gov Sani over skill acquisition programme
Summary: Shettima commends the Kaduna State Governor, Senator Uba Sani, for setting up and chairing the first Kaduna state Council on Skills, describing it as exemplary . The Vice President urges other subnational governments to follow suit .

Title: FG mulls  five-year strategic plan to tackle Lassa Fever
Summary: The Federal Government is to launch a five-year Lassa Fever Strategic Plan (2025-2029) The comprehensive plan will employ a “One Health” approach to address the problem .

Title: Delta bans workers from wearing bushy beards, artificial hair, others
Summary: Delta State Government has issued a new directive banning bushy beards, artificial braided or tainted hair, long eyelashes, fake nails, and other forms of what it calls “indecent appearance” among public servants . The ban was announced in a circular .

Title: Nigeria Custom announces dates for next phase of recruitment exercise
Summary: Online Computer-Based Test (CBT) set to take place from September 14 to 21, 2025 . This was disclosed in a public notice by the Nigeria Customs Service .

Title: Ndume rejects call for sack of service chiefs
Summary: Former Senate Leader Ali Ndume urges President Bola Ahmed Tinubu to disregard calls for the dismissal of the service chiefs . He says only a deliberate ‘TEAM approach’ (Training, Equipment, Ammunition, and Motivation) will give the Armed Forces edge .

Title: Qatar says funeral to be held Thursday for people killed in Israeli strike
Summary: Qatar says funeral to be held Thursday for people killed in Israeli strike . The first Israeli strikes in the Gulf sent shockwaves in a region long shielded from conflicts in the Middle East .

Title: Bauchi Govt uncovers 100 health ghost workers, to face sanctions
Summary: Bauchi state government says it has uncovered more than 100 ghost workers in the state's health sector . The state government vows to punish them under civil service rules .

Title: Police arrest self-acclaimed ‘Obi of Lagos’, halt planned coronation
Summary: Lagos State Police Command has arrested 65-year-old Chibuike Azubike for allegedly parading himself as the “Obi of Lagos’s”

Title: Peter Mandelson sacked as UK ambassador to US over Epstein links
Summary: Peter Mandelson sacked as UK ambassador to US over his friendship with late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein . UK government says he has been sacked over revelations about the late Epstein .

Title: Christian Eriksen signs with Bundesliga club Wolfsburg
Summary: Denmark international Christian Eriksen has joined German Bundesliga club Wolfsburg on a free transfer until 2027 . Denmark international has signed a two-and-a-half-year deal with the club .

Title: Soldiers arrest two cattle rustlers in Plateau, recover weapons
Summary: Troops of the 3 Division/Joint Task Force in Plateau state, Operation Enduring Peace, have arrested two notorious cattle rustlers and recovered arms and ammunition . Troops raided the hideout of the suspected rustlers following an intelligence-based operation and made the breakthrough . The arrested suspects and recovered items are currently in the custody

Title: Starmer sacks UK ambassador to US over Epstein links
Summary: UK leader Keir Starmer sacked Peter Mandelson on Thursday following fresh revelations about diplomat’s friendship with the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein . Foreign ministry said the prime minister had asked Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper to withdraw Mandelson as ambassador “in light” of newly revealed emails he wrote to Epstein . Dubbed the �

Title: LAUTECH teaching hospital nurses, midwives threaten strike
Summary: The National Association of Nigerian Nurses and Midwives, LAUTECH Teaching Hospital, issued a 15-day ultimatum to the management of the hospital in Oyo State . The workers claim they have been repeatedly excluded from new benefits approved for health workers in the state .

Title: Three police officers, two vigilantes killed in Kogi attack
Summary: Three police officers and two others were killed at a checkpoint in Kogi State on Wednesday . The deaths are among the deadliest in recent months, raising concerns over the safety of security personnel and the capacity of vigilante groups .

Title: NDLEA intercepts 112kg of cannabis in Kano road crash
Summary: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency, Kano State Strategic Command, has recovered 150 blocks and three sacks of cannabis sativa weighing 112kg . The interception was a sequel to a road accident at Gadar Tamburawa on the Zaria-Kano expressway . Incident involved two offences: one-way driving leading to a collision
